Hi all -

You might be interested in a supplemental chapter to "PMD Applied" that
I just released - "Better JUnit Tests with PMD".  It talks about how to
use the open source BSD-licensed static analysis tool PMD to help clean
up tests.  For example, PMD would suggest replacing this:

assertTrue(foo == bar);

with this:

assertSame("foo and bar should be the same", foo, bar);

So the tests get more informative and use more of the JUnit API; good
times.  This new chapter goes through all the PMD JUnit rules (1) and
talks about what they check for, how to fix the problems they find, and
so on.

You can download the chapter in PDF format here:

http://pmdapplied.com/

Comments and questions are welcome,

Yours,

Tom Copeland

(1) http://pmd.sourceforge.net/rules/junit.html
